snippet: Keeping them holed up on “lily pads” defeats the purpose of training troops.
abstract: Op-Ed article by author and former Marine Owen West expresses deep skepticism about Pres Obama's plan to deploy additional 450 troops to Iraq to act as advisers in fight against Islamic State; describes how his own experience in Iraq demonstrated that American troops can only affect combat outcomes by sharing in combat duties; argues project remains doomed to failure in its current, limited, state, especially amid corrupt backdrop of Iraqi politics.
lead_paragraph: Keeping them holed up on “lily pads” defeats the purpose of training troops.

headline.main: Why Obama’s Plan to Send Advisers to Iraq Will Fail

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
